info: The standard markup language every web developer must know to create the base of a webpage.
Flex, grid, margin, padding, borders; These are some properties that I always use to design, layout, and present webpages.
Learned Javascript ES6. A majority of my coding time is spent on developing JS to create dynamic web applications.
Front-end JavaScript library that I use to create functional, reusable components. This website itself was created with React.
Newer to my technologies and mainly used with React. TypeScript helps me enforce types on my JavaScript and reduce runtime errors.
I've tried Tailwind before and typically choose to stylize without it. However, I can see it being more useful on larger-scale projects.
As JavaScript is my programming language of choice, I chose Node.js to continue my back-end web-development outside the browser.
Express is a lightweight back-end web-applicaiton framework which handles all my web application HTTP requests and responses.
A fairly simple relational database management system (RDBMS) that efficiently organizes my databases as necessary.
Prisma allows my PSQL database to be scaled and developed along side my web applications with an OOP approach.
A useful middleware for Node.js which allows me to easily implement user authentication strategies such as JWTs.
Postman is a simple, intuitive tool that allows me to quickly develop and test APIs without the need for HTML forms.
Typical project control manager that works in tandem with GitHub.
Developer platform I use to manage, host, and share all my projects.
My go-to IDE for all web-development programming. I try to keep extensions to a minimal for a lightweight, clean experience.
Used to install packages in virtually all my projects including some tools you see here.
All my React projects have started out from a template using Vite. Great as a local development server for local rendering.
Used Webpack for bundling vanilla JavaScript modules and webpack-dev-server for live-previewing during production.
I am familiar the basics of UNIX/Linux CLI commands. I currently use Ubuntu as my main OS for web-development.
Before using an ORM, I would write many RESTful SQL database queries typically for CRUD instructions.
Implemented test-driven development for some web-applications by setting up unit tests with Jest before producing code.
EJS rendering engine that operates on the server to dynamically create HTML pages. Typically used for back-end templating.
Proficient with typical Microsoft Office software applications (i.e., Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, Sharepoint, Access, etc.).
When designing webpages, I aim to accommodate for different forms of media sizes and to be mindful of web accessibility.
